channel.title: Lagrangian Function on Amit Rajan
channel.description: Recent content in Lagrangian Function on Amit Rajan

item.title: Sparse Kernel Methods - Lagrange Multipliers
item.description: One of the significant limitations of learning algorithms based on non-linear kernels is that the kernel function $k(X_n, X_m)$ must be evaluated for all possible pairs $X_n$ and $X_m$ of training points. For us, it will be favourable that we shall look at kernel-based algorithms that have sparse solutions, so that predictions for new inputs depend only on the kernel function evaluated at a subset of the training data points. One of the most used sparse solution is support vector machine (SVM).
